intro: Calycera boopidea, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are often hairy. Calycera boopidea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
